personalInfo.clubAffl: Berkeley Hall CC (Bluffton, South Carolina), The Orchards Club (South Hadley, Massachusetts)

tourBios.curYrHigh: Earned his best finish on Tour at the Club Colombia Championship. Fired a bogey-free 66 in the third round to get within four of the leader. Continued to climb up the leaderboard in the final round. Birdied the 72nd hole to briefly tie Sebastian Munoz and Matt Atkins for the lead. Settled for a T2 when Munoz birdied the finishing hole for the victory.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)
tourBios.curYearHigh: Earned his best finish on Tour at the Club Colombia Championship. Fired a bogey-free 66 in the third round to get within four of the leader. Continued to climb up the leaderboard in the final round. Birdied the 72nd hole to briefly tie Sebastian Munoz and Matt Atkins for the lead. Settled for a T2 when Munoz birdied the finishing hole for the victory.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, making 14 cuts. Posted four top 25s. Finished 79th on the money list...Top finish of the year, a T11, came at The Rex Hospital Open in May, when he opened with 67-65. Was one shot behind leader Kyle Thompson. Shot 69-70 on the weekend to reach No. 74 on the money list, which would be his high point on the year...Next best finish was a T13 at the News Sentinel Open in Knoxville in October. A third-round 63 was best of the year and pushed him to T6. Shot 70 Sunday...Made the cut in his last seven starts but his average finish was 43rd, which was not enough to get him inside the top 75 and a spot in the Web.com Tour Finals...Playing on a sponsor exemption, made his PGA TOUR debut in July at the Barbasol Championship in Alabama. Shot 73-68 to make the cut. A 72-71 finish on the weekend resulted in a T72.

 2014: Finished T43 at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December. Scores of 67-65-69 in the third, fourth and fifth rounds were keys to his Q-School success...Won two events on the NGA Swingthought.com Tour...Won the Vermont Open and was runner-up at the Rhode Island Open.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won the 2013 Porter Cup...Was runner-up at the 2013 Tar Heel Intercollegiate, 2011 Southern Amateur, 2011 Northern Amateur and the 2011 New England Amateur...Named to the All-ACC Academic team in 2012 and 2014...Was an AJGA honorable mention All-American in 2009.
tourBios.personal: Grew up next door to The Orchards GC in South Hadley, Mass...Attended Heritage Academy in Hilton Head Island, S.C...Comes from a family of avid golfers. Father, Michael, was formerly a PGA club professional. Brother, Mickey, plays on the Texas A&M golf team...Earliest golf memory is going to Orlando, Fla., for the "Drive, Chip & Putt" national finals at ages 10 and 12...If not a golfer, would be an investment banker...Biggest thrill in golf was winning the Porter Cup...First tee intro song would be "Start Me Up" by the Rolling Stones...Favorite courses he's played are Augusta National and Old Marsh...Played soccer and basketball growing up...Keeps an Augusta National pencil in his golf bag...Favorite pro teams are the New England Patriots and Boston Red Sox...Favorite athlete is Tom Brady...Favorite college team is Georgia Tech...Favorite TV show is "The Blacklist" and movie is "Bridge of Spies."...Enjoys the music of Kenny Chesney...Favorite books are Seven Days in Utopia and American Sniper...Favorite city is Las Vegas...Likes car websites...Would like to trade places with Dale Earnhardt, Jr., for a day...Bucket list item includes attending an Advance M School at the BMW facility in Greenville, S.C...Best sporting event attended is U.S. Open at Bethpage State Park with parents and brother...Supports The First Tee...Was a participant on Golf Channel's "Big Break The Palm Beaches," which aired early in 2015...Twitter handle is @werenskir.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 2nd on the Web.com Tour 2 times in 2016.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T54th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
